attributes.action: Show he is making a clean break with the Blair years by abandoning the ID Cards scheme and Identity Register
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Since it was announced a couple of home secretaries ago, the Government scheme to introduce a national Identity Card has been shown by independent study after independent study to be unable to deal with any of the problems that beset the U.K. and in all likelihood will be another Government I.T. catastrophe, giving away millions of taxpayers money to the few chairpersons of the companies given the contract.

If Gordon Brown truly wants to 'let the work of change begin' he should cancel this pointless scheme now and divert the money into education and health, restoring the public's trust in Government by not requiring them to carry a card to prove they are a citizen.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence –
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/CardsID/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
